St._Louis.Kate Chopin House (St. Louis, Missouri):
Kate Chopin, born Katherine O'Flaherty (/ʃəʊpan/; February 8, 1850 – August 22, 1904), was an American author of short stories and novels based in Louisiana. She is now considered by some scholars  to have been a forerunner of American 20th-century feminist authors of Southern or Catholic background, such as Zelda Fitzgerald.
Of maternal French and paternal Irish descent, Chopin was born in St.
